title: What are the best old school hip hop songs of all time? - Quora

response.answer_text: Some of my favorite old school (80s-90s) rap songs include: (in no particular order) Any of Nas’ “Illmatic” songs - The greatest hip hop album of all time. With historic beats & intricate lyrics it was truly the best album.The Militia & Work by Gang Starr - Personally my favorite hip hop duo ever. With the combination of Guru’s rap skills & DJ Premier’s beats they produced a ton of hits including these two songs. Two of my fav’s.Who Shot Ya by Notorious B.I.G. - One of the hardest songs I’ve ever heard gives me chills every time I hear it. RIP to a legend Biggie Smalls.Against All Odds & Changes by Tupac - Another deceased rap legend. These are my two favorite Tupac songs. Changes is one of the most historic rap songs EVER. It’s smooth lyrics really show why Tupac is the best to ever grace the stage. Against All Odds is my favorite diss song ever as well. It goes super hard & is just a great song to rap along to.Don’t Sweat The Technique by Eric B. & Rakim, The Saga Begins - Rakim, When I B on tha mic - Rakim - Now for my last group of songs are by the hip hop legend Rakim. Personally my favorite emcee of all time he truly shaped & brought in a new era of rappers. All of these songs left a lasting impression of the rap world & are just a few more of my favorites. Oh & The Saga Begins has one of the best beats ever.

1. Audio Two - "Top Billin"   2. Doug E. Fresh and MC Ricky D - "La Di Da Di"   3. Ice-T - "6 in the Mornin'"   4. Eric B. & Rakim - "My Melody"   5. Public Enemy - "Shut 'em Down (Pete Rock Remix)"   6. Schoolly D - "P.S.K. What Does It Mean?"   7. LL Cool J - "Rock the Bells"   8. Big Daddy Kane - "Raw (Remix)"    9. Marley Marl - "The Symphony"   10. Boogie Down Productions - "South Bronx"
